quotes.quote: People everywhere confuse what they read in newspapers with news.
quotes.author: A. J. Liebling

quotes.quote: To read a newspaper is to refrain from reading something worthwhile.  The first discipline of education must therefore be to refuse resolutely to feed the mind with canned chatter.
quotes.author: Aleister Crowley

quotes.quote: Trying to be a first-rate reporter on the average American newspaper is like trying to play Bach's 'St. Matthew's Passion' on a ukulele.
quotes.author: Bagdikian's Observation

quotes.quote: Trying to determine what is going on in the world by reading newspapers is like trying to tell the time by watching the second hand of a clock.
quotes.author: Ben Hecht

quotes.quote: Literature is the art of writing something that will be read twice; journalism what will be read once.
quotes.author: Cyril Connolly

quotes.quote: USA Today has come out with a new survey - apparently, three out of every four people make up 75% of the population.
quotes.author: David Letterman

quotes.quote: Editor: a person employed by a newspaper, whose business it is to separate the wheat from the chaff, and to see that the chaff is printed.
quotes.author: Elbert Hubbard

quotes.quote: Rock journalism is people who can't write interviewing people who can't talk for people who can't read.
quotes.author: Frank Zappa

quotes.quote: Journalism largely consists of saying 'Lord Jones is Dead' to people who never knew that Lord Jones was alive.
quotes.author: G. K. Chesterton

quotes.quote: Half of the American people have never read a newspaper. Half never voted for President. One hopes it is the same half.
quotes.author: Gore Vidal

quotes.quote: All successful newspapers are ceaselessly querulous and bellicose. They never defend anyone or anything if they can help it; if the job is forced on them, they tackle it by denouncing someone or something else.
quotes.author: H. L. Mencken

quotes.quote: A newspaper consists of just the same number of words, whether there be any news in it or not.
quotes.author: Henry Fielding

quotes.quote: It's amazing that the amount of news that happens in the world every day always just exactly fits the newspaper.
quotes.author: Jerry Seinfeld

quotes.quote: Rage is the only quality which has kept me, or anybody I have ever studied, writing columns for newspapers.
quotes.author: Jimmy Breslin

quotes.quote: You must have a room, or a certain hour or so a day, where you don't know what was in the newspapers that morning... a place where you can simply experience and bring forth what you are and what you might be.
quotes.author: Joseph Campbell

quotes.quote: Once a newspaper touches a story, the facts are lost forever, even to the protagonists.
quotes.author: Norman Mailer

quotes.quote:
But what is the difference between literature and journalism?
...Journalism is unreadable and literature is not read. That is all.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.quote: Every journalist has a novel in him, which is an excellent place for it.
quotes.author: Russel Lynes

quotes.quote: Newspapermen learn to call a murderer 'an alleged murderer' and the King of England 'the alleged King of England' to avoid libel suits.
quotes.author: Stephen Leacock

quotes.quote: Advertisements... contain the only truths to be relied on in a newspaper.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.quote: I do not take a single newspaper, nor read one a month, and I feel myself infinitely the happier for it.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.quote: I read no newspaper now but Ritchie's, and in that chiefly the advertisements, for they contain the only truths to be relied on in a newspaper.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.quote: The man who reads nothing at all is better educated than the man who reads nothing but newspapers.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson
